definitions: person who takes part in a contest or competition to win a prize
examples: The contestant answered all the quiz questions correctly
Each contestant must register before the race begins

definitions: future event or circumstance that is possible but cannot be predicted with certainty and requires planning
examples: The company created a contingency plan for emergencies
We need to consider every contingency before launching

definitions: group of people forming part of a larger group, especially from a particular place
examples: A large contingent of supporters traveled to the game
The Canadian contingent arrived at the conference yesterday

definitions: act of continuing something or state of being continued without interruption
examples: The judge granted a continuance of the trial
The continuance of these policies depends on funding

definitions: action of carrying something on over a period of time
thing that continues or extends something else
examples: The continuation of the project requires more resources
We eagerly await the continuation of negotiations tomorrow
The new book is a continuation of her previous novel
This road is a continuation of the main highway

definitions: uninterrupted connection, succession, or union of elements over time
examples: The film lacks continuity between its scenes
Business continuity planning helps companies prepare for disasters

definitions: continuous sequence in which adjacent elements are not perceptibly different from each other
examples: Colors exist on a continuum from red to violet
Mental health exists on a continuum rather than categories

definitions: outline of a figure or body that defines its shape or form
examples: The artist carefully drew the contours of her face
The map shows the contours of the mountain range

definitions: goods that have been imported or exported illegally or are forbidden by law
examples: Guards searched the vehicle for contraband at the border
The smugglers were caught carrying contraband in hidden compartments

definitions: deliberate use of artificial methods or techniques to prevent pregnancy
examples: The clinic provides information about different contraception options
Access to contraception has improved in many developing countries

definitions: device or drug serving to prevent pregnancy from occurring
examples: The doctor prescribed an oral contraceptive for her patient
Many contraceptives are available without a prescription

definitions: business of entering into contracts to provide goods or services
examples: She started a contracting business specializing in home renovations
Government contracting requires careful attention to regulations

definitions: process of becoming smaller or shorter in size or duration
word or group of words shortened by omitting letters
examples: The contraction of metals occurs when they cool down
Economic contraction led to widespread unemployment last year
The word can't is a contraction of cannot
In formal writing, avoid using contractions like don't

definitions: combination of statements, ideas, or features that are opposed to one another
examples: His actions were in direct contradiction to his words
The report contains several contradictions that need clarification

definitions: statement or proposition that contradicts or denies another or itself
examples: The witness gave contradictory accounts of the incident
These two policies create a contradictory that needs resolution

definitions: machine or device that appears strange, unnecessarily complicated, or improvised
examples: He built a bizarre contraption to water his plants automatically
The old contraption in the garage still works perfectly

definitions: opposite or reverse of what has been said or suggested
examples: Evidence to the contrary suggests a different conclusion
On the contrary, I think your idea is excellent

definitions: action of doing something forbidden by a law or rule
examples: Parking here is in contravention of city regulations
The company acted in contravention of environmental laws

definitions: state of feeling remorseful and penitent for wrongdoing or sin
examples: He showed genuine contrition for his harmful actions
Her contrition was evident in her tearful apology

definitions: person responsible for controlling or administering an organization or system
device used to control the operation of a machine or system
examples: The financial controller oversees all accounting operations
The air traffic controller guided planes safely to landing
Press the button on your game controller to start
The temperature controller maintains optimal conditions automatically

definitions: region of injured tissue where blood capillaries have been ruptured
examples: The doctor examined the contusion on her shoulder
A severe contusion can take weeks to heal completely

definitions: confusing and difficult problem or question that is hard to solve
examples: The budget deficit presents a real conundrum for policymakers
Scientists face a conundrum in explaining these contradictory results

definitions: time spent recovering from an illness or medical treatment
examples: Her convalescence at home lasted several weeks
The resort specializes in convalescence care for surgical patients

definitions: person recovering from illness or medical treatment
examples: The convalescent needed help with daily activities
Several convalescents stayed at the rehabilitation center

definitions: movement caused within a fluid by tendency of hotter material to rise
examples: Convection currents in the atmosphere create weather patterns
The oven uses convection to cook food more evenly

definitions: person who calls people together for a meeting or activity
examples: The convener scheduled the committee meeting for Tuesday
As convener, she ensures all members receive the agenda

definitions: state of being able to proceed with something with little effort or difficulty
thing that contributes to an easy and effortless way of life
examples: Online shopping offers great convenience for busy people
The hotel location provides convenience for business travelers
The store stocks many conveniences for modern living
Having a car is a real convenience in rural areas

definitions: action of calling people together for a meeting or activity
examples: The convening of parliament happens every autumn
She is responsible for convening the board meetings

definitions: christian community of nuns living together under religious vows
examples: The old convent has been converted into apartments
She entered the convent at age twenty-one

definitions: process or state of converging toward the same point
examples: The convergence of the two rivers creates a delta
Technology convergence has transformed how we communicate

definitions: process of coming together from different directions to meet
examples: The converging of trade routes made the city prosperous
Scientists study the converging of tectonic plates

definitions: situation, object, or statement that is the reverse of another
examples: The converse is also true in this mathematical theorem
His statement and its converse are both logically valid

definitions: device for changing something into a different form or character
examples: The catalytic converter reduces harmful emissions from cars
You need a voltage converter when traveling abroad

definitions: car with a roof that can be folded back or removed
examples: She drove her red convertible along the coastal highway
The convertible is perfect for sunny weekend drives

definitions: action or process of transporting someone or something from place to place
legal process of transferring property from one owner to another
examples: Horse-drawn carriages were a common conveyance in the past
Public conveyance includes buses, trains, and subways
The lawyer prepared the conveyance documents for the sale
Property conveyance requires proper legal documentation

definitions: action of making an idea, feeling, or impression known or understandable
examples: The conveying of complex ideas requires clear language
His conveying of emotion through music touched everyone

definitions: continuous moving band used for transporting objects from one place to another
examples: The factory conveyor moves products through assembly stations
Airport luggage arrives on a conveyor belt system

definitions: large formal assembly of people, especially for a ceremony
examples: The university convocation celebrates graduating students each year
Religious leaders gathered for the annual convocation

definitions: group of ships or vehicles traveling together for mutual support and protection
examples: The military convoy moved slowly through the desert
A convoy of trucks delivered supplies to the region

definitions: soft murmuring sound made by a dove or pigeon
examples: The gentle coo of doves filled the morning air
We heard the coo coming from the rooftop nest

definitions: book containing recipes and instructions for preparing and cooking food
examples: She bought a new cookbook featuring Italian cuisine
The family cookbook contains three generations of recipes

definitions: appliance used for cooking food, especially a stove
examples: The electric cooker has four burners and an oven
She bought a pressure cooker to save cooking time

definitions: practice or skill of preparing and cooking food
examples: She studied cookery at a prestigious culinary school
Traditional cookery methods are still used in rural areas

definitions: pots, pans, and other utensils used for cooking
examples: The store sells high-quality stainless steel cookware
Non-stick cookware makes cleaning much easier after meals

definitions: liquid or gas used to remove heat from something
examples: Check the coolant level in your car regularly
The nuclear reactor uses water as its primary coolant

definitions: insulated container for keeping food and drinks cool
examples: Pack the drinks in the cooler with plenty of ice
The beach cooler kept our lunch fresh all day

definitions: process of becoming cooler or making something less warm
examples: The cooling of the metal takes several hours
Proper cooling prevents the computer from overheating

definitions: cage or pen for confining poultry, especially chickens
examples: The chickens return to their coop every evening
We built a new coop with better ventilation
